an8.1:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
an8.1:4.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
an8.1:5.1: “Mendicants, you can expect eight benefits when the heart’s release by love has been cultivated, developed, and practiced, made a vehicle and a basis, kept up, consolidated, and properly implemented.
an8.1:5.3: You sleep well. You wake happily. You don’t see bad dreams. Humans love you. Non-humans love you. Gods protect you. You can’t be harmed by fire, poison, or blade. If you don’t reach any higher, you’ll be reborn in a Brahmā realm.
an8.1:5.4: You can expect these eight benefits when the heart’s release by love has been cultivated, developed, and practiced, made a vehicle and a basis, kept up, consolidated, and properly implemented.”
an8.1:7.1: Loving just one creature with a hateless heart
an8.1:7.4: a noble one creates abundant merit.
an8.1:8.1: The royal potentates conquered this land
an8.1:8.4: the sacrifices of the ‘stick-casting’, the ‘royal soma drinking’, and the ‘unbarred’.
an8.1:9.1: These are not worth a sixteenth part
an8.1:9.2: of the mind developed with love,
an8.1:9.3: as all the constellations of stars
an8.1:9.4: aren’t worth a sixteenth part of the moon’s light.
an8.1:10.1: If you don’t kill or encourage others to kill,
an8.1:10.2: don’t conquer or encourage others to conquer,
an8.1:10.3: with love for all sentient beings,
an8.1:10.4: you’ll have no enmity for anyone.”
